ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: TAKE IT. By far one of the best courses I've taken at Yale.

ITAL 781 provides an in-depth reading of Boccaccio's Decameron. Prof. Marcus draws upon her own writing and scholarship about the text to provide guiding points and questions at each seminar meeting, and the bulk of the analysis done during discussion and in student papers is intended to draw upon a close-reading of Boccaccio's prose. The end of the semester includes a screening of Pasolini's film adaptation of the text, a spirited piece that does much to capture the bawdy essence of Boccaccio's original.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Although I enrolled in this course as an undergraduate (and so cannot speak about contributions to my dissertation/research), this course made me begin to think thatif I decide in the future to continue Italian studies at the graduate levelI may want to focus on medieval literature.
